programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes capped a big day with 291 yards passing and three touchdowns on a gimpy ankle. Mahomes went 5 for 5 on the only drive of overtime. Chiefs running back Kareem Hunt finished it off, along with his 106-yard rushing performance, by plunging into the end zone from 2 yards out to give Kansas City a 30-24 victory on Monday night over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce topple Josh Allen and the Bills in another post season classic. The Chiefs move on to the AFC Championship game for the sixth straight year following a Tyler Bass missed kick to tie the game with under two minutes remaining which ended up leading to a 27-24 Kansas City victory.

programme.desc: From quick knockouts to five round wars, Los Angeles is lit! Michael Manno fights Vincent Familari, Ukraine's Bovar Khanakov knuckles up against Ruben Warr and Anthony Garrett takes on Lavar Johnson.

programme.desc: Watch Brandon Conley battle Keith Richardson, Chase Gormely fight Tylor Sijohn and three more epic battles from Los Angeles!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Featherweights Justin Watson and Cole Ferrell hit the squared circle, followed by Crystal Van Wyk fighting Emma Murry. Finally see Joseph Creer knuckle up against David Simpson.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Including a lightweight fight between Mike Andaya and Dan Godoy and main event Evegney Kurdanov vs Elvin Brito, watch history unfold in the Squared Circle from BKFC Pechanga!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: UFC veteran Robbie Peralta returns to the Squared Circle to take on Jordan Christensen, Ryan Peterson and Matt Socholotiuk got at it, and heavyweights Iman Williams and Gabriel Mota put on a display of raw toughness for fight fans.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Edgard Plazaola takes on Alex Castro - two relentless lightweights who bring grit and explosive speed. Christine Ferea vs. Christine Vicens - The Misfit returns! Champion striker Christine Ferea faced rising force Christine Vicens.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Four all-out bare-knuckle wars featuring hard-hitting matchups: Sabah Homasi vs. Eduardo Peralta, Justin Ibarrola vs. Derek Perez, Bryan Duran vs. Kasim Ruffin, and Leonardo Perdomo vs. Levi Da Costa. No gloves, no backing down-just pure adrenaline.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: BKFC Knuckle Up features explosive bare-knuckle action and high-stakes matchups: John Garbarino vs. Apostle Spencer, Bec Rawlings vs. Taylor Starling, and a must-see war between two MMA legends-Jeremy Stephens vs. Eddie Alvarez.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: BKFC heats up with NAVID MANSOURI taking on RUSLAN TOKHTAROV in a fierce battle, ERNESTO PAPA facing DOMINIK ESTORER in a high-stakes clash, HAZE HEPI going head-to-head with STEVE BANKS, and CHRIS CAMOZZI locking horns with ANDREA BICCHI.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: BKFC Knuckle Up features a stacked lineup of bare-knuckle brawls, including Travis Thompson vs. Zach Pannell, Brandon Meyer vs. Zedekiah Montanez, Kaine Tomlinson Jr. vs. Pat Sullivan, and a massive heavyweight clash between Ben Rothwell vs. Mick Terrill.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Witness three brutal battles where toughness meets technique: Itso Babulaidze vs. Bryan McDowell - A high-octane clash between rising contenders. Patrick Brady vs. Zach Calmus - Two heavy-hitters collide in a gritty battle full of heart, determination, and knockout potential.

programme.desc: Knuckle Up is where grit meets glory: Dakota Cochrane vs. Will Santiago is a clash of veterans with knockout power and something to prove. Brennan Ward vs. James Dennis are two aggressive brawlers who collide in a wild, fast-paced slugfest.

programme.desc: High stakes poker in paradise. It's the first PCA in four years, with reigning champion Chino Rheem making a triumphant return to the Bahamas and dominating the feature table on Day 2 of the $10k Main Event.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Hundreds of players are competing in the PCA Main Event for a share of the $8.6m prize pool. US pros Maria Ho and Taylor Paur face off on the main stage, while reigning champ Chino Rheem continues to captivate and crush.

programme.title: The Comeback with Craig Carton
programme.desc: Craig Carton sits down with those who have experienced the highs and lows of gambling addiction to amplify their stories, break down the stigma surrounding gambling disorder, raise awareness of support resources for individuals and their families, and show that recovery is possible.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Time to make the money in the Bahamas. The top 127 in the PCA Main Event will get a slice of the $8.6m prize pool. At the feature table, British pro Sam Grafton plays against his hero, poker legend Jason Mercier.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: The $10k PCA Main Event is in the money and the field is still filled with talent. As Day 3 continues, the feature table is headlined by high stakes regulars Mustapha Kanit and Chance Kornuth and EPT winner Anton Wigg.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: In the Bahamas, the prestigious $10k PCA Main Event is playing down to the final two tables. Ramon Colillas and Noah Boeken are among the pros still in the running for the trophy and $1.5m first prize.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Just 16 players remain from almost a thousand entries at the PCA Main Event. Accomplished American Pro, Jonathan Little hopes to use his experience to make the Final Table and take a shot at the $1.5m first prize.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Station West
programme.desc: In 1881, former Army Lt. John Haven (Dick Powell) acts as a secret government agent on a covert mission to investigate the theft of numerous gold shipments. Haven confides his mission to Capt. George Ilse (Tom Powers), who is doubtful over the shifty Haven's intent. Haven agrees to report his results to reliable gold mine owner Mary Caslon (Agnes Moorehead), then searches for the town's financier, Charlie (Jane Greer), whose nefarious dealings immediately bring her under suspicion.

programme.title: Roughshod
programme.desc: Rancher Clay (Robert Sterling) and his brother, Steve (Claude Jarman Jr.), head out across the Sonora mountain pass, followed by Lednov (John Ireland), an ex-con seeking revenge on Clay for putting him behind bars. Clay and Steve unexpectedly cross paths with a group of dance hall girls -- including Mary (Gloria Grahame), Marcia (Martha Hyer) and Helen (Myrna Dell) -- whose stagecoach has broken down, and help them get to the nearest ranch, where Lednov unfortunately catches up to Clay.

programme.title: Lone Star
programme.desc: In the early 1840s, cattle baron Devereaux Burke (Clark Gable) is tasked by President Andrew Jackson (Lionel Barrymore) with an important diplomatic mission. Devereaux must convince soldier Sam Houston (Moroni Olsen) to help bring about the addition of Texas to the union. Along the way, Devereaux battles a pair of senators (Broderick Crawford, Ed Begley) who would rather create their own republic, and locks horns with a feisty newspaper reporter, Martha Ronda (Ava Gardner).

programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Skinny Bitch

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Nobody's Queen
programme.desc: The newly married millennial discusses terrible insurance, her record as an employee, and a cartoon character she just doesn’t trust.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Black Girl Panic
programme.desc: Jasmine Ellis reflects back at the formative experiences that formed her adulthood; to the delight of a full house in Austin, Texas, Ellis looks back at her parents, experiences in a mental hospital and interracial marriage as a Texan.

programme.title: Nicole Burch: Mama Drama
programme.desc: Nicole Burch opens up about getting pregnant from a one-night stand with her friend Craig and how she’s managing to co-parent a toddler with him.

programme.title: Nicole Burch: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: Nicole goes through the wringer with dating, until she meets her childhood crush: celebrity Michael Vartan. Will he break her unlucky-in-love streak?

programme.title: Andy Sandford: Shameful Information
programme.desc: This New York comic uses his first hour special to tackle only the important issues: burrito privacy, farting on airplanes, and McDonalds mix-ups.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Keith Robinson - Back of the Bus Funny
programme.desc: The comic brings his in-your-face style to everything from the moment he stopped liking his son to the real reason why Obama was elected.

programme.title: Morgan Murphy: Irish Goodbye
programme.desc: Wry and brilliant, Morgan Murphy delivers her sharpest, funniest jokes in this comedy special, showcasing her unmatched wit and humor.

programme.title: Rob Schneider: Soy Sauce and the Holocaust
programme.desc: Rob Schneider takes on lessons about love and other cultures, and telling side-splitting stories of the three hoods: childhood, adulthood, and parenthood.

programme.title: Arnez J.: Racially Motivated
programme.desc: Tackling everything from race relations to family life to hilarious impersonations, Arnez J is laugh-out-loud funny in his one-hour special.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: America 180°
programme.desc: Dennis Miller muses on life in America during Obama's second term and shares his views on healthcare, getting old, and where the country is headed.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: Fake News, Real Jokes
programme.desc: The king of dry wit is back to take down the current political and social climate — from selfies to airline travel to Donald Trump and the media.

programme.title: Eddie Pepitone: In Ruins
programme.desc: Comedic force of nature Eddie Pepitone delivers a darkly funny, rage-fueled performance in Brooklyn, where he discusses the perils of being a male model, speaking to his dog like his therapist, and the death of the American Dream.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the official start of spring and Mothering Sunday only days away, Monty Don and the team look at the practical ways to achieve a better looking garden at this busy time of year. Monty is selecting and planting climbing roses at his garden in Herefordshire and gives plenty of advice on how to get them to thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the clocks move forward, the longer days of spring are welcomed by every gardener. It's a busy time in the garden and the longer daylight hours present a great opportunity to get on with larger gardening projects. Weather permitting, Joe will join Monty in his garden to get to grips with lining his newly created pond giving plenty of advice for anyone wanting to use water in the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing apace, Monty shows us how we can take advantage of the new growth of all sorts of perennials, and begins by taking cuttings from emerging Delphiniums in his border and also from a pot grown plant. He also demonstrates the best way of planting Clematis against a wall to ensure a profusion of summer flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's Easter and the biggest gardening weekend of the year. The team give plenty of advice and inspiration - from large projects to tackling weeds. At Longmeadow, Monty is getting started on the vegetable plot, where he recommends a palette of potatoes for delicious summer crops. He also returns to his newly created pond, where he is showing how to conceal the liner with an attractive edge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The successes and failures of all our gardens begin with the humble seed. This show is packed with know-how about how to sow a seed and ideas about how you could improve your garden this summer. Monty starts by sowing tender vegetables like cucumbers and courgettes which, from unpromising beginnings, will provide a fruitful summer. Plus, Carol gives a masterclass on successful seed sowing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: If you have a shady spot in your garden which is bereft of flowers, then Monty Don has some great suggestions of stalwarts which not only thrive in those tricky conditions, but return year after year. He is also working in the vegetable plot giving his tips on what to sow and plant out now. Meanwhile, Carol Klein discovers the pulmonaria, growing prolifically in the woodlands and verges of the New Forest.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With plenty of advice and tips on how and what to plant in a pond, Rachel de Thame joins Monty at Longmeadow to give a helping hand. Monty also gets up to date with all the seasonal jobs in the jewel garden. Meanwhile, Carol follows the trail of one of spring's brightest plants to an allotment in South Yorkshire and a man who has amassed a national collection of euphorbias there.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the roses in his garden, harvests honey from his bees and gives advice on the maintenance of hardy geraniums as well as planting others for summer groundcover. Rachel de Thame shows how the most ordinary of spaces can be transformed by adding seasonal containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from the Malvern Spring Show where Monty Don, Carol Klein and Rachel De Thame bring the very best that the show has to offer. From planting and design in the show gardens, to new and exciting varieties in the floral marquee, they search out beautiful and innovative ideas to draw inspiration from.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Longmeadow with inspirational ideas and plants gathered at the Malvern Spring Show. He has tips and advice for planting bearded irises and then turns his attention to the pond where he shares ideas on different types of water lilies and how to plant them. Meanwhile, Carol Klein delves into the quirky world of ferns, discovering them in the wild and admiring their variety.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planting out his tender annual plants into a container for colour and interest all summer long. He is also busy in the vegetable garden with tips and advice on how best to grow cauliflowers and protect them so that you get to eat them before the birds and caterpillars do. Meanwhile, Carol Klein answers an unusual dilemma from a gardener who lives in a lighthouse.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden springing into life and new blooms opening each day, it gives Monty Don plenty of opportunity to get on top of all the seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. With a postbag full of gardening dilemmas, Carol Klein helps out one viewer with propagation queries. There's also a look behind the scenes with Rachel de Thame as she races to get the Royal barge planted up for the Thames Diamond Jubilee Pageant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the summer solstice so the days are the longest of the year and the sun is at its highest. With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don is in his borders replacing plants like wallflowers that are past their best with other annuals that will give colour right through to autumn. Meanwhile, Carol Klein will be answering a viewer's letter with advice on gardening to provide a habitat for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don reveals how the garden has changed over the last four weeks and gets to grips with a variety of jobs in the walled garden. Meanwhile, Carol Klein celebrates the hardy geranium and visits East Lambrook Manor, a beautiful garden that is host to a stunning array of this cottage garden stalwart.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame gets a preview of the gardens in the Olympic Park and meets those who have battled the elements to make sure they are at the peak of perfection; Carol Klein discovers London's wild side, exploring a community garden in the centre of the city that provides a haven for both flora and fauna; Joe Swift makes an exclusive visit to the historic garden at 10 Downing Street.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals what to plant for fragrance during summer before turning his attention to his herb garden, cutting back marjorman, rosemary and thyme to ensure abundance for the rest of the summer, and sharing tips on how to propagate culinary herbs. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame seeks out intoxicating scents on a visit to RHS Harlow Carr.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the garden reaches an abundance of growth in August, it's the pond, hedges, and edges of the garden which are the focus of attention. In the pond the growth of algae is at its height, so Monty recommends some plants which will eventually improve the quality of the water and help to prevent this unwelcome growth. He also gets going on cutting the hedges and mowing the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.desc: Possibly more rewarding then an invite to experience a new fishery is one's ability to return the favor. For Ali and Rush, sharing their home waters with others is one of the best parts of the job. While Rush takes SoCal friends Brandon and Eric Nelson fishing in Key West for Permit, Ali rounds up a familiar Florida Everglades native for some San Diego Bluefin Tuna fishing.

programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and champion angler Meredith McCord explore public waypoints and attempt to land a world record amberjack on light line. Panama City Beach’s backyard is the site of an epic battle in the first of two amazing episodes.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills “Stomper,Jr.” and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. We thoroughly enjoyed chasing this magnificent animal in Louisiana with our good buddies Drew Keith and Cole Cooper. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is heading offshore into the Gulf of America, eager to feed his offshore fishing obsession.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: After booking a trip at the last Indian River Clam Restoration banquete, the guys at Gold Key Roofing got a chance to fish with Capt. Blair and Capt. Mike Frenette.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Captain Blair returns to the everglades to do an inshore day but is challenged by the wind. Will he be able to find the size Snook he's looking for?

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson heads out to Crystal River, FL for a hot summer bite.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What makes you a better angler? It’s all in the details. Capt. Justin, Meredith McCord and Jeff Lange from Florida WaterSports go through the why, how and what to rig for different scenarios that bring success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick is joined by legendary frontman guitarist Dean Ween aka Mickey Melchiondo and Capt. Pat Murphy to hit the Jersey grounds to fluke fish and talk rock star passions.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick Joins Fisherman Magazine friends Dave Degenarro, Austin Perilli and Nicky DeGenarro for a reuniting of the Jersey families chasing the elusive Barnegat Bay weakfish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is fishing in the Northern Indian River Lagoon with DOA Lures Founder, Capt. Mark Nichols.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Possibly more rewarding then an invite to experience a new fishery is one's ability to return the favor. For Ali and Rush, sharing their home waters with others is one of the best parts of the job. While Rush takes SoCal friends Brandon and Eric Nelson fishing in Key West for Permit, Ali rounds up a familiar Florida Everglades native for some San Diego Bluefin Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: Sportsmans Journal
programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and champion angler Meredith McCord explore public waypoints and attempt to land a world record amberjack on light line. Panama City Beach’s backyard is the site of an epic battle in the first of two amazing episodes.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When Capt. Justin Leake attempts to blend in with the crowd aboard a local head boat, he finds friends, talented deckhands and a heck of a good time. Then we take Local Phil Chester to experience a Tarpon shoulder work out.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this episode, Capt. Jason heads out with his longtime hunting buddy to fish in Keaton Beach. Afterward, they head over to try and shoot some feral hogs on private land in North Florida.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this week’s episode Capt. Jason Dozier and His buddy Cody Williams head out of Key West to fish for pelagic and dive for Spiny lobster.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this episode Capt. Jason heads to Louisiana to fish and duck hunt with his buddies Capt. Britt Ordes and Ryan Lambert.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish with Daiwa’s Marc Mills out of Plantation Boat Mart trying out all of Daiwa’s new jigging equipment.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible out to the swordfish grounds.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in their new Invincible Catamaran with a trip to fish out of Palm Beach with their friend Captain Dave Fields.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fly kites with Captain Dave Fields for a great day of sailfishing out of Sailfish Marina in Palm Beach.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by John McCune for blue line fishing with Tad Murdock. Later they explore Helen Georgia during Oktoberfest.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny has got the gang back together. Ryan Sheffield and John McCune meet us in Helen Georgia for Oktoberfest and trout fishing on private waters.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Realtree's Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts hunt the tail end of the rut in Georgia. The bucks are still chasing the remaining does in heat as the weather cools off in the south.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills “Stomper,Jr.” and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. We thoroughly enjoyed chasing this magnificent animal in Louisiana with our good buddies Drew Keith and Cole Cooper. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Bryan Brown, Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon along with Lee Ellis on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and a tag was punched on an unexpected buck on opening day!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Coastal Conservation Association Florida Star Tournament redfish releases.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair fishes the South Texas flats using artificial lures with Capt. Luis Flandes.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Rex link up with Gehrig Dieter and Anthony Sherman from the Kansas City Chiefs. While filling the boat with crappie they got to learn about the guys and their careers in the NFL.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards are heads to Table Rock for the annual family vacation. Receding water poses a challenge but there’s no lack of fish or laughs at the lake!

programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is fishing in the Northern Indian River Lagoon with DOA Lures Founder, Capt. Mark Nichols.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Killing Fields

programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.desc: This film is the story of two great military men, their relationship, and the plotting of the global offensive, which turned the tide of World War II.

programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: Crooked House
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Wind Chill
programme.desc: On their way home for the holidays, two college students break down on a deserted road and are preyed upon by the ghosts of people who died there.

programme.title: Darkness Falls
programme.desc: A troubled man returns home to save his childhood sweetheart and her little brother from the evil spirit that murdered his mother.

programme.title: The Fog
programme.desc: A deadly fog terrorizes the residents of a small bayside town as its ghastly secret of merciless revenge takes them over and must be unraveled.

programme.title: Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid
programme.desc: The ’Anaconda’ franchise returns as a rogue researcher uses foul tactics to keep his research assistants in peril in a hostile snake-filled jungle.

programme.desc: A giant snake is ready to give birth to more forked tongued-killers. Now, a mercenary and his team race to stop the serpents’ destructive spree.

programme.desc: The 4th installment of the “Anaconda” universe is a scary thrill ride about a genetically engineered anaconda that can regenerate and multiply itself.

programme.title: 28 Days

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Doctor Faustus

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball

programme.title: First Men in the Moon

programme.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Shockproof
programme.desc: Jenny Marsh (Patricia Knight) is a hard-luck dame who's just finished five years in the slammer for killing a man. Jenny's not exactly the murdering type -- she did the deed while defending her jailbird lover, Harry (John Baragrey), which is probably one reason she's attracted the attention of her parole officer, Griff Marat (Cornel Wilde). In fact, Griff is so taken with Jenny that he gets her a job caring for his ailing mother, but although Jenny tries to fly right, she's not yet over Harry.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You

programme.title: Divorce American Style

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Revenge Rider
programme.desc: A cowboy suspects a local cattleman's association is behind the murder of his brother, the sheriff.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Secret Patrol
programme.desc: A Mountie (Charles Starrett) works under cover to solve the murder of his best friend.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Square Shooter
programme.desc: A cowboy framed for the murder of his uncle sets out to bring the real killers to justice after his release from jail.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.desc: After unknowingly robbing a syndicate bank, an ex-con demands $250,000 from the mob to avenge his brother's death in a dangerous quest for justice.

programme.desc: Lavish biography of the French queen who "let them eat cake."

programme.desc: A small-town boy's school experiences the joys and pains of growing up.

programme.desc: A newlywed couple's honeymoon is disrupted by a friends' marital problems.

programme.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
programme.desc: A man gets mixed up in palace intrigue when a king-to-be is kidnapped.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Room for One More

programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the top salesperson for a beauty company pyramid scheme is murdered, the team sifts through a long list of possible suspects who would want her dead; Adam befriends a homeless man.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Junior is torn between his duties and his feelings for his former girlfriend when her new man is one of the culprits in a bank heist-turned-homicide.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Tani and Junior go under cover at a gym to track down a deadly batch of steroids; Danny and McGarrett work as bodyguards for Danny's high maintenance ex-mother-in-law, a famous romance novelist with whom he has never gotten along.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After students use e-mails and text messages to organize a spontaneous gathering at a golf course, the body of a high-school senior is found.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team tracks the killer of an 18-year-old woman, an investigative aide for Alcohol Beverage Control who was monitoring underage drinking when she was murdered at a hip Miami nightclub.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The wife of a famous Miami ballplayer is found murdered in her home, and her philandering husband is the prime suspect until his corpse is found in the house too.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: As a tidal wave heads toward Miami, Horatio and the team must stop a gang of bank robbers who are trying to take advantage of the natural disaster.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger dedicated to exposing government corruption is murdered; during the investigation, it is revealed that a war crime may have occurred during a humanitarian effort in Bolivia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a highly regarded Navy pilot is killed after crashing a new, high-tech jet at an air show, the team must determine if it was human or mechanical error.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Navy drone pilot is murdered after using a black market drone to obtain military surveillance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When an Australian Royal Navy Lieutenant is murdered in New Orleans, Special Agent Naomi Parsons (Kate Beahan) is sent to work with Special Agent Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a petty officer is found dead, the team's participation in the annual Red Dress Run comes to a halt.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An extremely intelligent Navy coder -- employed by Brody's mom (Annie Potts) -- is put in danger when the heart intended for him is stolen.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After traveling to Texas to escort a key witness to the trial of an infamous arms dealer, Sonja and Special Agent Pride are ambushed.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: During a blackout in New Orleans, Pride is determined to figure out who murdered a family friend's fiance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Marine's murder reveals new clues in the first case LaSalle and Pride worked together; a Thanksgiving celebration at Pride's bar.

programme.desc: Wade's adopted son becomes a suspect after a series of Christmas burglaries turn deadly; Brody and LaSalle tease Sonja about the team's holiday gift exchange.

programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team investigate a Russian sleeper agent involved with Abby's brother; Sebastian goes to Washington, D.C., to work with Abby; Bishop drives all night to deliver a package and help the New Orleans team.

programme.desc: The staged suicide of a petty officer turns out to be murder; the team secretly works on an online dating profile for Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Mardi Gras celebration at Pride's bar is cut short when he and Mayor Douglas Hamilton (Steven Weber) are abducted by unknown assailants.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Evidence suggests that the man responsible for saving a lieutenant's life is a soldier who was captured in Afghanistan.

programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team uncover a domestic drug ring -- led by Sonja's childhood friend, Marion Watkins (Samaire Armstrong), that is producing cocaine.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant dies during a secret visit to a general's hotel, agent Pride and the team are asked to break protocol for the investigation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio sets out on a personal mission to find his mentor's killer, and Megan worries that he has become too emotionally involved in the case.
